About.subTitle: Providing individual support to people with difficult access to education and growing together in the process - that is the aim of iSTEP.

whoIs.title: Who is iSTEP
whoIs.subTitle: The idea of iSTEP originated in 2015.
whoIs.text: Adrian Burkhalter launched the NGG (Next Generation Give & Grow) project as part of his work as a learning mentor at Swisscom. For seven years, he ran IT courses in collaboration with over 300 participating apprentices, from which over 500 asylum seekers benefited. After retiring, Adrian developed this idea further privately and so, after a few months of development work, the iSTEP association was founded in early summer 2023. The team now consists of 12 members. We also work together with various aid organizations.

enable.title: Enable
enable.text: Our multimedia and IT courses provide participants with a solid foundation of office, design and coding skills, making it easier for them to enter the job market and equipping them for independent further training.

createSpace.title: Creating space
createSpace.text: We create a space for exchange, support and acceptance. Personal development and the promotion of social skills and teamwork are fundamental cornerstones. But it also offers a place to share experiences, the everyday and the extraordinary, and to be together.

appreciation.title: Appreciation
appreciation.text: We meet other people with kindness, respect, and openness. No matter where a person comes from, what they believe, or where they are in life, we are open, appreciative, and empathetic toward everyone.

individualSupport.title: Individual Support
individualSupport.text: In our activities, the person with their own experiences is at the center. We provide our participants with individual support and make sure to encourage them according to their level.

growingTogether.title: Growing Together
growingTogether.text: Our passion is to show people new perspectives, give them a sense of confidence, and motivate them to take the next step. Through valuable exchange, we learn and grow together with our participants.

Home.subTitle: Supporting individuals with limited access to education and growing together – this is the goal of iSTEP.

whatWeDo.title: What We Do
whatWeDo.subTitle: We specifically look for projects that can sustainably support disadvantaged people.
whatWeDo.text: Disadvantages can take many forms. A person might be seeking asylum, orphaned, or have not received the education they were entitled to. iSTEP provides support, for example, in the form of multilingual training modules that can be conducted online or on-site, with or without supervision. Depending on the knowledge level, the content includes skills in Microsoft Office, multimedia skills, or learning programming languages.
whatWeDo.text2: To sustainably support these individuals, we rely on local support. Our partners share our vision and ensure that we stay in touch with participants after the initial on-site engagement. In addition, we support participants after the first engagement with our continuously growing online offerings.

Additionally, you will gain knowledge about general computer usage and network technologies. This course is ideal for turning your interest in technology into practical, applicable knowledge.

courses.title: A2B Elbasan: Creative Online Course
courses.description: The Multimedia course is perfect for you if you are passionate about creative work on computers – regardless of your prior knowledge. In this course, you will learn step by step everything from basic computer user skills to using common applications such as Office 365. You will dive into the world of multimedia and learn how to use various programs to create impressive projects.
courses.whatYouLearnText: The topics vary widely and cover different aspects of digital work. There is no overarching schedule for when each topic is covered, as this depends on the instructors of each course date. If you are interested, get in touch with us and we will gladly explain what is currently being taught in the courses. Below are topics we have already covered, but new ones may be added anytime:
whatYouLearnList: Computer User Basics: Introduction to the basic operation and usage of your computer.

Office 365: You will learn the basics of using the essential Office applications Word, PowerPoint, and Excel. Depending on availability, the free LibreOffice versions Writer, Impress, and Calc will be used.

Design and Layout with Canva: Basics of design (e.g., typography, color theory, layout). You will learn what makes an appealing design and how to go from a blank page to a finished design. The implementation takes place in Canva, a design program that can be used both in the browser and as an application.

Photography with Darktable: You will learn the three fundamental camera settings, different image settings, and principles for creating an appealing picture. You will also learn how to edit your photos using Darktable.

Videography with DaVinci Resolve: You will learn about film history and how films are made. You will write a script with guidance, create a storyboard, and film it. This can be done with a camera or smartphone. Editing and cutting the film will be done using DaVinci Resolve.
workpiecesList: Film production: Writing a script, filming, editing, adding sound, and exporting.
courses.courseOrganizationText: Courses are held continuously every two weeks on Saturdays from 10:00 AM to 2:00 PM. Registration is possible at any time. However, since some topics span multiple Saturdays, you may need to review past materials in self-study when you join mid-topic. This ensures you won't miss any important information. If you have any questions, feel free to contact the course instructors.
requirementsList: Basic computer knowledge is helpful but not mandatory

For certain topics, a smartphone for recording or an email address for registering with a computer program may be required. This will be communicated to you in advance. If you don't have these, we will find a solution together.

OurProjects.subTitle: The iSTEP association was founded in early summer 2023. The team now consists of 12 members.

OurKnowHow.subTitle: Individually supporting people with limited access to education and growing together – that’s the goal of iSTEP.

digitalSkills.title: Digital Skills
digitalSkills.text: Our volunteers possess a wide range of digital skills acquired through education and in their work. Here’s a small selection.

otherSkills.title: Other Skills
otherSkills.text: While our current focus is on digital education, we are always open to teaching other valuable skills. Our volunteers can also share the following knowledge:

Projects.title: Pilot Project Digital Literacy for Refugees (Digital Skills)
Projects.teaser: iSTEP supports a pilot project by Powercoders, conducted at the Tiefenau collective accommodation in Bern. In eight course modules, asylum seekers learn the basics of everyday digital life. Topics range from using the internet and email communication to job searching and online interviews. The aim is to provide participants with the necessary tools to integrate into our digitalized society.

Projects.title: Lezha
Projects.teaser: In the small town of Lezha in northwest Albania, iSTEP collaborates with the locally active Venerini Sisters. We supplement the educational offerings at the high school run by the Venerini Sisters with additional computer science courses and support the teachers in the IT field.

details.theLocationText: Lezha is a small, quiet town in northwest Albania, not far from the beautiful tourist beaches of Shëngjin. The Venerini Sisters run a high school here, as well as a reintegration center and a stepping stone for young women transitioning into adulthood. We work closely with local organizations and volunteers to build on existing projects.
details.whatWeDoText: Since September 2023, iSTEP has been active at the high school in Lezha, expanding the school’s IT curriculum with additional online modules for interested students. In January 2024, we launched the first pilot web development block course. In twelve online segments and five in-person lessons, students were taught the basics of web development using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Participants successfully completed the course with their own website project and a final exam. The block course will be offered again in the next school year for new students. We also provide advice and help the IT teaching staff with preparing teaching materials.
details.whatWeDoText2: For the young women from the Casa Rozalba I reintegration center, we offer general computer courses as needed, helping them equip themselves with the necessary digital skills for the transition to adult life.

Projects.title: Elbasan
Projects.teaser: Elbasan is a larger city in central Albania. iSTEP is building on the existing school project of the Aid to the Balkans (A2B) organization here. We equip the school and day care center for disadvantaged children and youth with laptops. In ongoing courses, participants can develop and deepen their multimedia and IT skills.

details.theLocationText: Elbasan is the fourth largest city in Albania. On the outskirts of Elbasan lies the A2B center of the eponymous charity. The center offers a kindergarten, as well as a lunch service providing warm meals to children and youth from a nearby school. As part of their after-lunch activities, the center also provides homework help and tutoring. Although primarily aimed at children from poorer backgrounds, the services are also open to better-off families, preventing stigma and fostering a beneficial mixing of social groups. The building also serves as a storage facility for aid goods and food for the organization’s other programs. iSTEP uses A2B’s aid shipments to send IT materials to Albania.
details.whatWeDoText: Since our first deployment in September 2023, iSTEP has been offering regular online courses for the children at the A2B center, building on the center's daily structure programs. The courses take place every 14 days and are modular in design. Through this continuity, we achieve a progressive learning effect and build trust with the children and young people. Regular exchange also allows us to understand the participants' interests and provide individualized support when needed.
details.whatWeDoText2: The courses are supported by local translators to ensure that even children with limited English skills can participate. The program is divided into two main areas: One focuses on creative skills, teaching design concepts, as well as image and video editing, while the other focuses on IT skills.

Projects.title: Gjadër
Projects.teaser: In the small village of Gjadër, located near Lezha, is the youth and aid center Casa Rozalba I run by the Venerini Sisters. Here, children and women from difficult circumstances find a new home. iSTEP complements the existing educational offerings of the center with computer courses. We also provide laptops and other equipment to help women and children access the digital world.

details.theLocationText: Gjadër is a small village a few minutes by car from Lezha. It is known for its abandoned military airport, which now serves as a scrapyard for old aircraft. The deserted runway cuts through the village, shaping its landscape. Right next to the dilapidated runway is the Casa Rozalba I youth and aid center run by the Venerini Sisters.
details.whatWeDoText: Since iSTEP’s first outreach in September 2023, we have been offering introductory courses in general computer skills and office applications at Casa Rozalba. As many of the children and women at the center come from difficult circumstances, iSTEP also provides material support, supplying the residents with laptops and peripherals. The focus of our on-site missions is to bring interested individuals to a technical level that allows them to participate in further online courses.

Projects.title: Librazhd
Projects.teaser: Librazhd is a small town in the Librazhd municipality in the Elbasan district in southeastern Albania. It is iSTEP’s newest location, opened during an operation in Elbasan in 2024. The team met a couple who volunteer with youth, and quickly realized that iSTEP could complement their program with online courses.

details.theLocationText: Librazhd lies in the valley of the Shkumbin River, with the border to North Macedonia just ten kilometers east. The town lies on an important traffic axis connecting Albania’s coast with the southeast and North Macedonia. A couple has set up a volunteer project here, offering leisure activities for youth, among other things.
details.whatWeDoText: In August 2024, iSTEP held a one-week MS Office basic course with the youth in Librazhd as part of a pilot project. The course was very well received, and all parties agreed that the collaboration with iSTEP should continue. The new project site has been equipped with the necessary start-up materials, including laptops and peripherals, so that Librazhd can officially join iSTEP’s online course program. Ongoing online courses are planned to begin in November 2024.

swiss.name: Adrian
swiss.text: My life has been shaped by the privileges in Switzerland. For this, I am grateful, but at the same time, I am deeply concerned about the social and societal injustices. This led to an inner drive to share my good fortune with disadvantaged people. I regularly took part in volunteer missions both in Switzerland and abroad. All these encounters, experiences, and challenges not only expanded my horizon but also led to great inner gratitude. My vision is to invest in other people, their wishes, and their projects. Together with a new team, we are now opening the next chapter of iSTEP. I am curious and excited to see who we will reach and accompany on their STEPs.

swiss.name: Aline
swiss.text: Working with people makes me happy. Helping people and making a difference in their lives is my motivation. When I came into contact with this work during my training, I immediately knew I wanted to continue supporting and be part of this project even after my training.

swiss.name: Dominic
swiss.text: The world of technology offers endless possibilities and has allowed me to expand my horizons and pursue an exciting career. It’s an exciting journey filled with challenges and moments of success. I am happy to share the knowledge I have gained and help others embark on their own transformative journey.

swiss.name: Sven
swiss.text: Not everyone is fortunate enough to be born in a country with equal opportunities and access to good education. For me, it is one of the greatest privileges to pass on my knowledge to people who have been denied such opportunities. The gratitude of these people fills me with pride and is a constant motivation to advance the vision of iSTEP.

swiss.name: Matt
swiss.text: The exchange of knowledge and culture between people from diverse backgrounds is fascinating. Being right in the middle of it is even more exciting. Through my missions, I can share my expertise with these people, helping them gain new perspectives while simultaneously broadening my own horizons.

swiss.name: Michelle
swiss.text: During my training, I had the opportunity to accompany people from other countries and cultures on a part of their journey. This experience enriched me more than I initially imagined. That is why I now want to continue this work and give others the same opportunity.

swiss.name: Olivia
swiss.text: As part of my training, I had already had the chance to work on the predecessor project of iSTEP. The exchange with people from other cultures and backgrounds was a valuable and enriching experience that I am now continuing at iSTEP. I am eager to share my enthusiasm for IT with others and help them acquire knowledge that will support them on their future path.

swiss.name: Maxim
swiss.text: Intercultural exchange has always fascinated and interested me. During my exchange year in Russia, I gained insight into a culture that was previously foreign to me, which significantly expanded my horizons and helped me grow. This year also made me more aware of my privileges, especially the privilege of being able to enjoy free, good education, which enables me to be a more attractive person both professionally and personally. Unfortunately, not all people in the world have such easy access to quality education. Through iSTEP, I want to help make education more accessible and improve the lives of less privileged people in a sustainable way.

swiss.name: Yannic
swiss.text: Working with different people is very interesting to me. During my training, I came into contact with this work. I enjoy helping others and expanding my skills while passing on knowledge.

swiss.name: Deborah
swiss.text: My conviction regarding the urgency of social justice motivated me to join iSTEP. Collaborating with people from diverse cultural backgrounds not only brings me joy, but I also see it as essential to achieve common goals. With my studies in Design Management International and my passionate commitment to design in the context of social change, I see iSTEP as a significant opportunity to help disadvantaged people access education.

swiss.name: Marc
swiss.text: I'm still working on my text...

swiss.name: Nadine
swiss.text: I'm still working on my text...

albaniaLezha.name: Izabela
albaniaLezha.text: When I heard about the project, I immediately knew I wanted to be a part of it! I knew that this project would be an innovation for Albanians. It would give everyone interested in technology a new opportunity! I am grateful and more than happy about this project!

albaniaElbasan.name: Fabjan
albaniaElbasan.text: Working with iSTEP helps me contribute and positively impact the lives of children.

albaniaElbasan.name: Peki
albaniaElbasan.text: Technology and IT skills are some of the most important abilities required today. My desire is to give all children and adults the opportunity to acquire and develop these skills. In collaboration with iSTEP, we have the opportunity to launch this project in Elbasan. Moreover, we aim to motivate children to learn and discover their potential.
